instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.3V3_G3H: What is 3V3_G3H? This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not starting.
threads.message:
Hi,


Got this board, water damaged in smc area. Display also wasnt working. Replaced display and <CHIP>U9850</CHIP> and got image. After that macbook began failing. As i had donor board and there was liquid damage in smc area i changed it too.

Now macbook is not turning on. Tried another SMC and same result. It get's 5.20V and 0.04 Amps on all usb-c ports. PPBUS is 0V. Lifted <RESISTOR>R6907</RESISTOR> and getting 5V on pin 2.


I dont thinkg it's one of ports ic (<CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>) because there is no water damage in that area.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not starting.
threads.message:
You cannot be completely sure which areas have been affected by liquid.
Check for knoccked off, or moved components in SMC area (even opposite site).
Also check all LDO outputs of <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips.

Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not starting.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>P3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> is ok <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3.4V


Cant find anything strange near SMC also other side. LDO Outputs are also ok.

I tried to mount logic board in the macbook and now (with battery connected) it is getting 20V but still 0 A.


I was testing this same board before with same charger (61W) and it was getting 20V even without battery, Also tried with his 87 W charger and it directly block entrance ( No V no Amps.)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not starting.
threads.message:
This board should work with 87W charger without battery.
I'm not sure if it can start with 61W one, without battery connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not starting.
threads.message:
Dont understand why it blocks my magsafe (ori). 


anything else i can check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not starting.
threads.message:
Try another 87W original charger.
Did you try to start with both 61W charger and battery connected?
Also try to start in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not starting.
threads.message:
tried with other 87W and it is blocking too. 

With battery and 61W conector i get 20V instead of 2V (without battery) but 0.00 Amps. Also tried SMC bypass but there is no way

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not starting.
threads.message: tomorrow will measure all rails again and post.
